verb.description: Come between so as to prevent or alter a result or course of events.
examples: he acted outside his authority when he intervened in the dispute
their forces intervened to halt the attack

verb.description: Occur in the time between events.
examples: to occupy the intervening months she took a job in a hospital

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense come in as an extraneous factor or thing): from Latin intervenire, from inter- between + venire come.
